citeinfo.title: Environmental Studies of Macrozoobenthos, Aquatic Macrophytes, and Juvenile Fishes in the St. Clair-Detroit River System, 1983-1984: Macrophyte Sample Processing Record

descript.abstract: This macrophyte sample processing record data set was collected for use in the administrative report entitled "Environmental Studies of Macrozoobenthos, Aquatic Macrophytes, and Juvenile Fishes in the St. Clair-Detroit River System, 1983-1984". It is a portion of the data collected for this administrative report, which provided information needed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers for preparation of a Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement addressing the winter operation of the lock facilities at Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan, and the subsequent extension of the navigation season in the St. Clair-Detroit River system (SCDRS) to January-February. The following is excerpted from the original report's abstract: We describe the distribution and abundance of macrozoobenthos, aquatic macrophytes and juvenile fishes during the 1983 and 1984 open water season, and attempt to predict or evaluate the potential environmental impact of an extended navigation season on the biota of SCDRS. Fauna and flora were diverse and abundant; we identified more than 300 taxa of macrozoobenthos, 30 taxa of submergent and emergent macrophytes, and 36 species of fish. The diversity and abundance of macrozoobenthos were generally highest in the St. Clair River. Abundance and diversity of submersed macrophytes were similar in the two rivers, but Chara dominated in the St. Clair River and Vallisneria americana in the Detroit River. We collected more total fish in the Detroit River but more species in the St. Clair River. Yellow perch and rock bass dominated most catches in both rivers. An ice jam in the St. Clair River in spring 1984 appeared to affect two of the three groups studied--macroinvertebrates and submersed macrophytes. Of the 24 abundant taxa of macroinvertebrates, 9 were seemingly less abundant in spring in 1984 than in 1983 in the St. Clair River; however the densities of 6 of these taxa had recovered by fall 1984 to levels equal to or exceeding those in fall 1983 and the other 3 were within 30% of those in 1983. Cover of the bottom with submersed macrophytes was somewhat reduced in spring of 1984--particularly in the St. Clair River--but recovered to 1983 levels by fall 1984. Plant biomass levels varied between years and locations; no consistent differences could be attributed to the ice jam. Catches of fish were lower in 1984 than in 1983 but differences between locations and months were inconsistent. Observed differences in the plant community could be attributed to reduced temperatures, and ice-scour may have reduced the density of several taxa of macrozoobenthos. Evaluation of the potential environmental impacts of an extended navigation season on the biota of SCDRS was not attempted.
descript.purpose: These data describe the distribution and abundance of macrophytes, and attempt to predict or evaluate the potential environmental impact of an extended navigation season on the biota of SCDR. These data were collected for a USACOE Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement addressing the winter operation of the lock facilities at Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan, and the subsequent extension of the navigation season in the St. Clair-Detroit River system (SCDRS) to January-February.
descript.supplinf: This sample processing record for aquatic macrophytes data set was created for the use in the titled report to administration. It contains location, specie, and biomass information. In the laboratory, macrophytes were sorted and identified by consulting taxonomic keys. Dry weight (105°C for 24 hours) and ash-free dry weight (525°C for 24 hours) of each taxon in each sample was determined to the nearest 0.1 mg and reported as grams of plant matter per square meter of substrate sampled. The analysis was done on dry weight biomass, but results can be converted to ash-free dry weight (AFDW)using equation provided in report. More detailed methodology available in report, which also includes the following related appendices: I: Aquatic Macrophyte Sampling Locations, J: Grapnel Collections of Submersed Macrophytes, K: Submersed Macrophyte Grapnel Data -A Summary. L: Ponar Grab Collections of Submersed Macrophytes, M: Collections of Emergent Macrophytes, N: Index Charts for Aerial Photographs and Photographs of Macrophyte Study Areas, 0: Macrophyte Distribution Maps, and P: ANOVA Tables of Macrophytes.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: This data was collected for reporting to the Department of the Army, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Detroit-District, Detroit, Michigan 48231. The scientific review process for this report may differ from other publication types. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

procstep.procdesc: Development of the data set by the agency / individuals identified in the 'Originator' element in the Identification Info section of the record.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attr.attrdef: File names of original electronic data sources

attrdomv.udom: 3-digit number representing the form used to collect original data in the field

attr.attrdef: Lake or river where sample was taken
General geographic location where sample taken

attrdomv.udom: Single digit corresponds to part of river where sample taken: upper St. Clair River, lower St. Clair River, Lake Saint Clair, upper Detroit River, lower Detroit River.

attr.attrdef: Station number; the part of the river where sample was collected

attrdomv.udom: 1 and 2 digit numbers correspond to specific depth locations; not measurements.
1 or 2-digit number (values of 1-13) corresponding to the replicate number for each block.

attr.attrdef: Numeric code used for organism species identification.

attrdomv.udom: 4 or 5 digit whole number corresponding to species.

attr.attrdef: Gross tare weight of biomass; need to multiply by (0.1) for actual weight
Gross dry weight of biomass; need to multiply by (0.1) for actual weight
Gross ash weight of biomass; need to multiply by (0.1) for actual weight
Weight of sample material before dessication; need to multiply by (0.1) for actual weight
